person.persName: Luther C. Jeffries (Montgomery County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Son of Enoch Jeffries and Nancy Tapp Jeffries. Married to Ann Means Jeffries. Father of Leora C. Jeffries and Breckenridge P. Jeffries. Graduate of Transylvania Medical College in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1849. Physician in Montgomery County in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in 1850. Owned at least three enslaved persons, including Mary, in Montgomery County in 1853. Physician in Montgomery County from 1852 through 1865. Owned at least two enslaved persons, including Lucas, in Montgomery County in 1859. Owned six enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Hired out on behalf of John R. Wilson four enslaved persons, Dallas, Caroline, George Henry, and Mary Dallas, in Montgomery County for 1862. Hired out on behalf of John R. Wilson three enslaved persons, Dallas, Mary, and Caroline, in Montgomery County for 1863. Owned seven enslaved persons, including Mahala, Sally, Sarah, Laura, Lucas, Lucy, and Minerva, in Montgomery County in 1865.
